title: Running torch.cuda.is_available() before import from torch._C import *
body_html:
Issue description

Using a NFS, sometimes I find myself on machines without Cuda, although PyTorch was installed on a Cuda enabled machine. PyTorch fails to load and crashes instead.

Code example

In [1]: import torch
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
ImportError                               Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-1-23eb050c9654> in <module>()
----> 1 import torch

[...]/atcold/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/__init__.py in <module>()
     78     pass
     79
---> 80 from torch._C import *
     81
     82 __all__ += [name for name in dir(_C)

ImportError: libcudart.so.9.0: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory

System Info

  • PyTorch or Caffe2: PyTorch
  • How you installed PyTorch (conda, pip, source): conda, on a Cuda enabled machine
  • OS: CentOS 7
  • PyTorch version: 0.4.1
  • Python version: 3.6.6
  • CUDA/cuDNN version: N/A or 9.0

body:
## Issue description

Using a NFS, sometimes I find myself on machines without _Cuda_, although _PyTorch_ was installed on a _Cuda_ enabled machine. _PyTorch_ fails to load and crashes instead.

## Code example

```python
In [1]: import torch
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
ImportError                               Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-1-23eb050c9654> in <module>()
----> 1 import torch

[...]/atcold/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/__init__.py in <module>()
     78     pass
     79
---> 80 from torch._C import *
     81
     82 __all__ += [name for name in dir(_C)

ImportError: libcudart.so.9.0: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory
```

## System Info

- PyTorch or Caffe2: _PyTorch_
- How you installed PyTorch (conda, pip, source): `conda`, on a _Cuda_ enabled machine
- OS: _CentOS_ 7
- PyTorch version: `0.4.1`
- Python version: `3.6.6`
- CUDA/cuDNN version: `N/A` or `9.0`
